definition: with little or no activity or no agitation, of the sun characterized by a low level of surface phenomena like sunspots e.g., a disposition free from stress or emotion, make calm or still
details:
adverb
- with little or no activity or no agitation
= example: with little or no activity or no agitation
= synonyms: quietly
adjective
- of the sun characterized by a low level of surface phenomena like sunspots e.g.
- (of a body of water) free from disturbance by heavy waves
= synonyms: placid, tranquil, smooth, unruffled, still
- in a softened tone
= synonyms: subdued, muted, hushed
- not showy or obtrusive
= example: not showy or obtrusive
= synonyms: restrained
- free of noise or uproar
- characterized by an absence or near absence of agitation or activity
= example: characterized by an absence or near absence of agitation or activity
noun
- a disposition free from stress or emotion
= synonyms: repose
- the absence of sound
= synonyms: silence
- an untroubled state
= synonyms: tranquillity, tranquility
- a period of calm weather
= synonyms: lull
verb
- make calm or still
= example: make calm or still
= synonyms: still, calm, lull, tranquillise, tranquilise, tranquilize, tranquillize, quieten, calm down
- become quiet or quieter
= synonyms: hush, quieten, quiesce, quiet down, pipe down
